metadata.bijbeltekst: The Passion According to St. Matthew

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, in the person of Jesus, sovereignly chooses to enter into human suffering, shame, and godforsakenness to reconcile and forgive both victims and perpetrators.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus... has planned the whole thing.
It is his free and sovereign choice to relinquish all his divine prerogatives.
God has chosen a way that is precisely antithetical to the way that we would have done it.
Jesus, in his death, makes himself one, not only with my pain, but also with my sin
the heart of the God who has extended his love into the darkest places
how would the Scriptures be fulfilled
it pleased God through the foolishness of what we preach
for those who seek to follow the Messiah
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one needing forgiveness) and the Opponent (the one who shouts 'crucify').

helper.identificatie: The 'Foolishness' of the Cross / The Holy Spirit (implied through witness)
tekstueel_bewijs: the foolishness of God is wiser than human wisdom
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External power manifesting in the witness of figures like Tutu and Mandela.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Human Wisdom, and the 'Powers of this world'
tekstueel_bewijs: the wickedness of those who inflict suffering
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but a structural 'darkness' and 'godforsakenness' that only a 'Crucified God' can enter.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response: participating in the 'Procession of Fools' through radical forgiveness.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (e.g., Tutu, Mandela, the Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical act of forgiveness (Program 2) is explicitly grounded in the prior, sovereign act of Christ's forgiveness on the cross (Program 1).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Divine Foolishness → Jesus Christ ← Sin/Worldly Power

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus... has planned the whole thing.
He will not allow himself to be defined...
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We want to see believable demonstrations...
You and I would have done the same...
We are a procession of fools.

voorbeelden: we have to make an extra effort to understand
It is his free and sovereign choice.
they know not what they do
the weakness of God is stronger than human strength

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' of God manifested in 'Weakness'. It emphasizes that humans lack the power to save themselves or even to forgive without the prior empowerment of the Cross.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the 'Worldly Wisdom' (S2) of the crowd to the 'Dereliction' (~S2) of the Cry, finally resolving in the 'Divine Foolishness' (S1) of the Cross.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God entering the position of the Opponent/Forsaken (~S2) to bring them into Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the 'Cry of Dereliction' is treated as the key to the narrative.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Jesus is the primary actor who 'chooses' and 'plans' the passion. Human action is framed as either failure (the crowd) or a secondary response to grace (Tutu).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we have to make an extra effort to understand

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus... has planned the whole thing.
wickedness of those who inflict suffering... Hell itself

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mandela and Tutu are used as examples, but they are framed as 'witnesses' to a power not their own.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The crowd (as a negative model of us)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by grounding their ability to forgive in Christ's prayer on the cross.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'winning' is replaced by the 'foolishness' of being loved in weakness.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation with synergistic ethical fruit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the biblical narrative to contemporary examples of reconciliation is seamless because the underlying actantial roles remain consistent.
spanning_punten: The tension between Jesus' 'imperial control' and his 'agonized impotence'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: What Jesus assumes on the Cross is not only the suffering of innocents but also the wickedness of those who inflict suffering.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'power' to the 'Word of the Cross' rather than explicitly to the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is seen as a 'darkness' that requires the death of God.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative program. Humans are correctly positioned as Receivers of grace before being called as Subjects of the secondary (ethical) program.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on Savoir (Knowledge) in the middle section.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's Power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly link the 'knowing' of the disciples to the 'power' of the cross.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly identified as sin and death.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. It avoids the trap of making the 'procession' a work we must perform, instead inviting us into a reality God has already constructed.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'fool' metaphor; Greimas shows that the 'fool' is actually the Receiver of a divine Object.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Matthew; semiotics explains how the sermon's 'engine' moves the hearer from 'Opponent' to 'Receiver'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'sovereignty' of Jesus is the functional Subject even when he is the grammatical Object of the soldiers' abuse.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (chooses, plans, stands, gives, makes himself one)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Cry of Dereliction' to anchor the semiotic square in the most radical contradiction possible (God vs God).
